channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12783] Create efficient RegionLocator implementation
item.description: A new HRegionLocator that only implements RegionLocator functionality will be more efficient to instantiate than a full HTable.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: For now, I'm simply creating a new implementation of RegionLocator. We can slowly remove the implementation from HTable.
Hm... I guess I forgot tests. I'll work on that.
I made a lot more changes. All regionlocator like functionality now ends up going to HRegionLocator one way or the other.
I had to make some other changes to convert concrete class uses to the new interfaces. I found a few HTables and etc that were not being closed, and closed them.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

This message is automatically generated.

For HRegionLocator.java, package name is normally after the license header.


+@InterfaceAudience.Private

+@InterfaceStability.Evolving

Evolving is not needed for Private class.


+  public HRegionLocator(TableName tableName, ClusterConnection connection, Configuration configuration) {

Configuration can be obtained from ClusterConnection. Can this parameter be omitted ?

From class javadoc: Get as needed and just close when done.


+  public void close() throws IOException {

+    // This is a no-op.

+  }

Is close() is a no-op, why does client need to call it ? Is this subject to change in the future ?


+    final List<byte[]> startKeyList = new ArrayList<byte[]>(regions.size());

+    final List<byte[]> endKeyList = new ArrayList<byte[]>(regions.size());

Can array of byte[] be allocated since we know the size already ? This would save startKeyList.toArray() call.

Putting patch on review board would make future reviews easier.
This update includes test fixes and changes to HRegionLocator as per Ted Yu.
